cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses various approaches to learning, including domain adaptation, active learning, learning under covariate shift, semi-supervised learning, and learning with concept drift, which are all subfields of machine learning. The paper specifically focuses on the use of surrogate loss functions to compare the performance of different classifiers, which is a common topic in the subfield of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also mentions examples related to computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL), which are subfields of machine learning. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of semi-supervised learning, which is a subfield of both machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper discusses the use of performance metrics, which is a common topic in the subfield of social and information networks (cs.SI).
